intro: Zanthoxylum amapaense, commonly known as the Amazon prickly ash, is a deciduous shrub native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces red, berry-like fruits that are an important food source for various wildlife species. Zanthoxylum amapaense is also valued for its medicinal properties, with parts of the plant used in traditional medicine. Its ability to thrive in humid, tropical environments makes it an important component of the rainforest ecosystem.
